documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: httpd:2.4 security update

note.text:
An update for the httpd:2.4 module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The httpd packages provide the Apache HTTP Server, a powerful, efficient, and extensible web server.

Security Fix(es):

* httpd: NULL pointer dereference via malformed requests (CVE-2021-34798)

* httpd: Out-of-bounds write in ap_escape_quotes() via malicious input (CVE-2021-39275)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

note.text: httpd: NULL pointer dereference via malformed requests
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

reference.Description: bz#2005128: CVE-2021-34798 httpd: NULL pointer dereference via malformed requests
